text:
November 28, 1961
Mr. John Walker Powell
590 Bedford Road
Pleasantville, New York
Dear John:
This is Just a note to express my apologies for my failure to
respond to your very kind and courteous invitation to participate in
the panel for the AEA conference.
The truth is, I guess, that I was rather hesitant to accept your
invitation, feeling that I was perhaps inadequate to the Job and wonÂ¬
dering if I should accept or suggest someone else in my place. Then
a trip to the Netherlands plus the NAEB National Convention disrupted
things and 1 never did get around to responding before I took off rather
precipitously for Bogota.
I want you to know, however, that I am not in the habit of
treating my correspondence in quite such cavalier fashion, and I do
want to beg your pardon for this inattention.
I saw Scotty a few weeks ago and he believes the book will be
top-notch. I am looking forward to its publication. And next time you
come to Washington - please give me a call.
Cordially yours.
William G. Harley
WGHjadt
